alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Lunenburg; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 7:23PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Lunenburg, southeastern Nottoway, Dinwiddie, southeastern Amelia and northern Brunswick Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 723 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wilsons to near Kenbridge. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Dinwiddie, Blackstone, Victoria, Kenbridge, McKenney, Alberta, Wilsons, Fort Pickett, Dewitt, Dundas, Sutherland, North Wellville, Cochran, Irby, Addison, Ammon, Murdocks, Forkland and Darvills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and south central Virginia.
